      18                 :            :   * \ingroup Core_Module
      19                 :            :   *
      20                 :            :   * \brief Expression of the reverse of a vector or matrix
      21                 :            :   *
      22                 :            :   * \param MatrixType the type of the object of which we are taking the reverse
      23                 :            :   *
      24                 :            :   * This class represents an expression of the reverse of a vector.
      25                 :            :   * It is the return type of MatrixBase::reverse() and VectorwiseOp::reverse()
      26                 :            :   * and most of the time this is the only way it is used.
      27                 :            :   *
      28                 :            :   * \sa MatrixBase::reverse(), VectorwiseOp::reverse()

      46                 :            :     MaxColsAtCompileTime = MatrixType::MaxColsAtCompileTime,
      47                 :            : 
      48                 :            :     // let's enable LinearAccess only with vectorization because of the product overhead

      77                 :            :     using Base::IsRowMajor;
      78                 :            : 
      79                 :            :     // The following two operators are provided to worarkound
      80                 :            :     // a MSVC 2013 issue. In theory, we could simply do:
      81                 :            :     //   using Base::operator(); 
      82                 :            :     // to make const version of operator() visible.
      83                 :            :     // Otheriwse, they would be hidden by the non-const versions defined in this file
      84                 :            :     
      85                 :            :     inline CoeffReturnType operator()(Index row, Index col) const
      86                 :            :     {
      87                 :            :       eigen_assert(row >= 0 && row < rows() && col >= 0 && col < cols());
      88                 :            :       return coeff(row, col);
      89                 :            :     }
      90                 :            :

      93                 :            :       eigen_assert(index >= 0 && index < m_matrix.size());
      94                 :            :       return coeff(index);

      98                 :            :     enum {

     100                 :            :       IsColMajor = !IsRowMajor,
     101                 :            :       ReverseRow = (Direction == Vertical)   || (Direction == BothDirections),
     102                 :            :       ReverseCol = (Direction == Horizontal) || (Direction == BothDirections),
     103                 :            :       OffsetRow  = ReverseRow && IsColMajor ? PacketSize : 1,
     104                 :            :       OffsetCol  = ReverseCol && IsRowMajor ? PacketSize : 1,
     105                 :            :       ReversePacket = (Direction == BothDirections)
     106                 :            :                     || ((Direction == Vertical)   && IsColMajor)
     107                 :            :                     || ((Direction == Horizontal) && IsRowMajor)

     197                 :            : /** \returns an expression of the reverse of *this.
     198                 :            :   *
     199                 :            :   * Example: \include MatrixBase_reverse.cpp
     200                 :            :   * Output: \verbinclude MatrixBase_reverse.out
     201                 :            :   *
     202                 :            :   */
     203                 :            : template<typename Derived>
     204                 :            : inline typename DenseBase<Derived>::ReverseReturnType
     205                 :          6 : DenseBase<Derived>::reverse()
     206                 :            : {
     207                 :          6 :   return derived();
     208                 :            : }
     209                 :            : 
     210                 :            : /** This is the const version of reverse(). */
     211                 :            : template<typename Derived>
     212                 :            : inline const typename DenseBase<Derived>::ConstReverseReturnType
     213                 :            : DenseBase<Derived>::reverse() const
     214                 :            : {
     215                 :            :   return derived();
     216                 :            : }
     217                 :            : 
     218                 :            : /** This is the "in place" version of reverse: it reverses \c *this.
     219                 :            :   *
     220                 :            :   * In most cases it is probably better to simply use the reversed expression
     221                 :            :   * of a matrix. However, when reversing the matrix data itself is really needed,
     222                 :            :   * then this "in-place" version is probably the right choice because it provides
     223                 :            :   * the following additional features:
     224                 :            :   *  - less error prone: doing the same operation with .reverse() requires special care:
     225                 :            :   *    \code m = m.reverse().eval(); \endcode
     226                 :            :   *  - this API allows to avoid creating a temporary (the current implementation creates a temporary, but that could be avoided using swap)
     227                 :            :   *  - it allows future optimizations (cache friendliness, etc.)
     228                 :            :   *
     229                 :            :   * \sa reverse() */
     230                 :            : template<typename Derived>
     231                 :            : inline void DenseBase<Derived>::reverseInPlace()
     232                 :            : {
     233                 :            :   derived() = derived().reverse().eval();
     234                 :            : }
     235                 :            : 
     236                 :            : } // end namespace Eigen
     237                 :            : 
     238                 :            : #endif // EIGEN_REVERSE_H
